result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph S Connolly

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called briefly at approximately 9:56am, and then at 10:21am 
Defendant Joseph S. Connolly in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA  Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance; a victim is present by audioconference. 
Captain J. Szwec - sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Parson
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Connolly committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment: 
Service of Information is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
In response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 10:39pm 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on October 26th at 10:00am,  (2) Status Conference on November 17th at 2:00pm
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:43am 
Defendant Joseph S Connolly in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
This case was scheduled for Preliminary hearing at 9:00am today and the parties and the State's officer-witness have been present in the courtroom. However due to calendar congestion, the Court has called the matter late.  
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance, however it is learned that the victim who was present on the telephone for the hearing had to ring off due to time-constraints.  
The Court is rescheduling the Preliminary Hearing due to victim rights compliance concerns.
recess 10:47am. 

NEXT: Preliminary hearing on September 23rd at 9:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Att De La Rosa
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 1:16pm 
Defendant Joseph S Connolly appears via telephone from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1
--if Mr. Connolly is the only person on the lease for the residence located at 119 1/2 E. Racine Street, he shall be permitted to reside in the home and he shall be permitted to reside in home once Victim 1 vacates. If Victim 1 has not left, he may return one time with law enforcement to retrieve personal belongings. 
recess 1:24 pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 8/19/22 at 9:00am

Victim Witness Key
